questions.question_text:
Madeupcorp.com is in the process of migrating from a third-party email system to G Suite. The VP of Marketing is concerned that her team already administers the corporate AdSense, AdWords, and YouTube channels using their @madeupcorp.com email addresses, but has not tracked which users have access to which service. You need to ensure that there is no disruption.
What should you do?

choices.A: Run the Transfer Tool for Unmanaged users.
choices.B: Use a Google Form to survey the Marketing department users.
choices.D: Contact Google Enterprise Support to identify affected users.
choices.C: Assure the VP that there is no action required to configure G Suite.

discussion.content:
I believe the answer is C.
Google Workspace has no way to translate for each region for the footer. 
https://support.google.com/a/answer/2364576?hl=en

D is correct
Because, the question mentioned 4 countries with 4 different languages. 
In this tutorial: https://support.google.com/a/answer/2364576?hl=en
We can choose OU, each OU will correspond to each sales office in each country. The footer will be translated into each country's language. It will then be added to the footer for each OU corresponding to that country
It appears to be that C is correct because there is no way to translate to other languages.

Selected Answer: D
It's 4 footers because It's 4 OUs

Selected Answer: D
Why should we ensure that each sales team is in their own OU if we don't need to have localized footer ? 
C would have been someting like "Ensure that each sales team is the same OU" to have only one footer.

I checked this https://support.google.com/a/answer/2364576?hl=en, and didn't find any way can have multi footer setting
~~
C is correct
The best option is C?
Questions doest say anything about translation so I would go with option C.

choices.A: Send an email to each sales person with the instructions on how to add the footer to their Signature.
choices.B: Ensure that each sales team is in their own OU, and configure the Append Footer with the signature and footer content translated for each locale.
choices.D: Ensure that each sales team is in their own OU, and configure the Append Footer with the footer content translated for each locale.
choices.C: Ensure that each sales team is in their own OU, and configure the Append Footer with footer content.

questions.question_text:
Your company has sales offices in Madrid, Tokyo, London, and New York. The outbound email for those offices needs to include the sales person's signature and a compliance footer. The compliance footer needs to say "Should you no longer wish to receive emails about this offer, please reply with UNSUBSCRIBE." You are responsible for making sure that users cannot remove the footer.
What should you do?

discussion.content: D is correct answer , as login is most targeted actions post phishing attack

Selected Answer: D
correct answer is D
D is correct
the answer is D. https://support.google.com/a/answer/6197480?hl=en

choices.B: Set up an Admin audit log event alert.
choices.D: Set up a suspicious login event alert.
choices.A: Set up a Token audit log event alert.
choices.C: Set up an email settings changed alert.

questions.question_text: What action should be taken to configure alerting related to phishing attacks?

A company using G Suite has reports of cyber criminals trying to steal usernames and passwords to access critical business data. You need to protect the highly sensitive user accounts from unauthorized access.
What should you do?

discussion.content: B is more secure isn't it?

B. Security keys are the most secure form of 2SV and protect against phishing threats.
https://support.google.com/a/answer/175197?hl=en#keys&prompt&authentic&codes&phone&2sv&security

Selected Answer: D
Like all are saying, 2FA with hardware keys is the recommended practice by google but i think that if you want protect to your organization inmediatly you need enable the 2FA with the app is faster than wait to arrive the hardware keys, both answers are right, iÂ´m just thinking in the faster option
B is both the most secure solution and the one officially recommended by Google.

Selected Answer: B
B is Google recommend practice.
https://support.google.com/a/answer/175197?hl=en#zippy=%2Cconsider-using-security-keys-in-your-business

Selected Answer: B
correct answer is B

Selected Answer: B
B is the most secure way

comments.content: It is the most secure way, but it is not the cheapest and users tend to lose them. D I believe is the correct answer

discussion.content: why not D ?
B is correct

B is the most secure way to enable 2SV or 2FA on a google identity. Please review the following support article for additional details. https://support.google.com/a/answer/175197?hl=en#keys&prompt&authentic&codes&phone&2sv&security
B is the correct answer, is more secure
yo admcloud, are u a bot? pls stop spamming all the questions. the discussion here clearly states that the answer is C. Hence the high number of upvotes to the above comments
the best option would be B?
B is Correct. Physical keys have always been stressed as the most secure method since the Advance Protection Program by Google themselves. https://landing.google.com/advancedprotection/
B for me as well
B. Google recommends authenticator app only as an alternative to security keys in https://support.google.com/a/answer/175197?hl=en (Best practices for 2-Step Verification section)

choices.B: Enforce 2FA with a physical security key.

discussion.content:
Vote for c
To open the shared matter, the account must be assigned an admin role with the Manage Holds, Manage Searches, Manage Exports, or Manage Audits privilege (or any combination). Learn more
C is correct. The legal team will need to control holds, search, and exports. They can't do that without having permission to do so.
Vote for C. The legal team needs to have a access via Google Vault

Selected Answer: C
C will give needed permission to access and use Vault
A will give too much permission and no Vault access. B is non sense. D doesn't allow legal team to do their own investigations later.
C is correct
C is the correct answer. https://support.google.com/vault/answer/2799699
Could you confirm if option C would be the correct answer?
D is correct answer here.

D
https://support.google.com/vault/answer/2462477
Even you share a matter, the user still need to be granted custom admin role to access the contents in Vault

choices.B: Add the legal team to the Google Vault Google Group.
choices.A: Add the legal team to the User Management Admin system role.
choices.C: Create a custom role with Google Vault access, and add the legal team.
choices.D: Create a matter in Google Vault, and share with the legal team.

questions.question_text:
After migrating to G Suite, your legal team requests access to search all email and create litigation holds for employees who are involved with active litigation. You need to help the legal team meet this request.
What should you do?
